intro: Inversodicraea annithomae, commonly known as the Annithomea hibiscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
